summary: Produces a summary of alignment metrics from a SAM or BAM file.

arguments.name: --ADAPTER_SEQUENCE

arguments.summary: read one or more arguments files and add them to the command line
arguments.name: --arguments_file

arguments.summary: If true (default), then the sort order in the header file will be ignored.
arguments.name: --ASSUME_SORTED

arguments.summary: A flag to disable the collection of actual alignment information. If false, tool will only count READS, PF_READS, and NOISE_READS. (For backwards compatibility).
arguments.name: --COLLECT_ALIGNMENT_INFORMATION

arguments.summary: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and VCF).
arguments.name: --COMPRESSION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: Whether to create an index when writing VCF or coordinate sorted BAM output.
arguments.name: --CREATE_INDEX

arguments.summary: Whether to create an MD5 digest for any BAM or FASTQ files created.
arguments.name: --CREATE_MD5_FILE

arguments.summary: Paired-end reads that do not have this expected orientation will be considered chimeric.
arguments.name: --EXPECTED_PAIR_ORIENTATIONS

arguments.summary: Google Genomics API client_secrets.json file path.
arguments.name: --GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS

arguments.summary: display the help message
arguments.name: --help

arguments.summary: If Provided, file to write read-length chart pdf.
arguments.name: --HISTOGRAM_FILE

arguments.summary: Input SAM or BAM file.
arguments.name: --INPUT

arguments.summary: Whether the SAM or BAM file consists of bisulfite sequenced reads.
arguments.name: --IS_BISULFITE_SEQUENCED

arguments.summary: Paired-end reads above this insert size will be considered chimeric along with inter-chromosomal pairs.
arguments.name: --MAX_INSERT_SIZE

arguments.summary: When writing files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort the file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.
arguments.name: --MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM

arguments.summary: The level(s) at which to accumulate metrics.
arguments.name: --METRIC_ACCUMULATION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: The file to write the output to.
arguments.name: --OUTPUT

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.

arguments.summary: Reference sequence file. Note that while this argument isn't required, without it a small subset (MISMATCH-related) of the metrics cannot be calculated. Note also that if a reference sequence is provided, it must be accompanied by a sequence dictionary.

arguments.summary: display hidden arguments
arguments.name: --showHidden

arguments.summary: Stop after processing N reads, mainly for debugging.

arguments.summary: One or more directories with space available to be used by this program for temporary storage of working files

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Deflater instead of the Intel Deflater for writing compressed output
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_DEFLATER

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program.  Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --VALIDATION_STRINGENCY

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --VERBOSITY

arguments.summary: display the version number for this tool
arguments.name: --version

description:
A command line tool to read a BAM file and produce standard alignment metrics that would be applicable to any alignment. Metrics to include, but not limited to:
  • Total number of reads (total, period, no exclusions)
  • Total number of PF reads (PF == does not fail vendor check flag)
  • Number of PF noise reads (does not fail vendor check and has noise attr set)
  • Total aligned PF reads (any PF read that has a sequence and position)
  • High quality aligned PF reads (high quality == mapping quality >= 20)
  • High quality aligned PF bases (actual aligned bases, calculate off alignment blocks)
  • High quality aligned PF Q20 bases (subset of above where base quality >= 20)
  • Median mismatches in HQ aligned PF reads (how many aligned bases != ref on average)
  • Reads aligned in pairs (vs. reads aligned with mate unaligned/not present)
  • Read length (how to handle mixed lengths?)
  • Bad Cycles - how many machine cycles yielded combined no-call and mismatch rates of >= 80%
  • Strand balance - reads mapped to positive strand / total mapped reads
Metrics are written for the first read of a pair, the second read, and combined for the pair. Chimeras are identified if any of the of following criteria are met:
  • the insert size is larger than MAX_INSERT_SIZE
  • the ends of a pair map to different contigs
  • the paired end orientation is different that the expected orientation
  • the read contains an SA tag (chimeric alignment)
name: CollectAlignmentSummaryMetrics (Picard)
